application_type_full: Prior Approval: Development for electronic communications network
decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - Under Schedule 2, Part 16 of the General Permitted Development Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval would be required and REFUSED as to the siting and appearance of the proposed development for the following reason: 

The proposal, by reason of its prominent siting, design, appearance and height would result in an unduly dominant, incongruous and visually intrusive form of development that would adversely affect the character, appearance and the visual amenity of the Morden Road streetscene and harm the character and views into and from the adjacent Wandle Valley Conservation Area, Metropolitan Open Land and nearby Grade II Listed Morden Hall Park. The proposal would be contrary to Policies DM D1, DM D2, DM D4, DM D6 and DM O1 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014; Policies CS 13 and CS 14 of Merton's Core Strategy 2011; and Policy D8, HC1 of the London Plan 2021.
Reason : 2 - Under Schedule 2, Part 16 of the General Permitted Development Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval would be required and REFUSED as to the siting and appearance of the proposed development for the following reason: 

In the absence of a heritage statement describing the significance of any heritage assets affected using appropriate expertise including the nearby Wandle Valley Conservation area and Grade II Listed Morden Hall Park, the proposal does not accord with chapter 16 of the NPPF 2021 and policy DM D4 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.
description: PRIOR APPROVAL FOR THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A 5G TELECOMS H3G 17M STREET POLE AND X3 ADDITIONAL EQUIPMENT CABINETS.
